The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-persistent-row-identifier: Use studyID as the anchor, plus a persistent row identifier to identify a specific file/version, etc.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-persistent-row-identifier-val: Enter a unique identifier for the selection made.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-appliesto: Indicates the level of entity to which a metadata value applies (e.g., individual participant or population summary).
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-aggregationlevel: Specifies whether a metadata value represents individual-level data or an aggregate summary
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-populationscope: Identifies the population described by the metadata (e.g., study-wide, cohort, or study arm).
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-persistent-row-identifier-ext: Other external identifier, if no GUID exists
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-optional-persistent-row-identifier-gui: Global Unique Identifier: unique across studies and repositories. If a participant has been assigned a global identifier (e.g., NDAR GUID), include it here to support linkage across studies and repositories. Otherwise, leave this field blank.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-diseasefocus: Primary disease or condition focus of the study. A categorical descriptor summarizing participant health status selection and ascertainment context for a study cohort, intended to support discovery and comparison across studies.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-primaryhealthfocus: Why participants were included: these categories describe participant health status at enrollment, not outcomes.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-ascertainmentcontext: Where participants came from: the categories describe sampling context, independent of diseas focus
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-selectionintensity: How restrictive enrollment was: the categories describe selection methodology
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-populationtype: Broad classification of the population sampled in the study/cohort.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-populationdescriptor: Free-text descriptor capturing key population characteristics not covered by controlled terms (e.g., “male veterans”, “older adults with caregiver support”).
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-agegroup: Broad age-based population grouping represented in the cohort.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-sex: The biological classification of a participant, typically assigned at birth based on physical and genetic characteristics.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-sexdistribution: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by sex category.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-sexeligible: Sex eligibility criteria for cohort inclusion (if the study restricts enrollment).
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-gender: The socially and culturally constructed identity that describes a person’s self-identified gender, which may or may not correspond to sex assigned at birth and may change over time.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-genderdistribution: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by self-identified gender.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-race: Self-reported race/ethnicity. A socially defined classification that reflects a participant’s self-identified racial group(s), based on shared social, historical, or cultural experiences, and not biological or genetic differences.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-racedistribution: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by self-identified race category or categories.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-ethnicity: Self-reported race/ethnicity. A self-identified cultural classification that reflects whether a participant identifies as being of Hispanic or Latino origin, independent of race.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-ethnicitydistribution: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by self-identified ethnicity.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-generation: Generation within family cohort (ex., F0=original, F1=child, F2=grandchild). Indicates the generational position of participants within a family-based cohort, relative to the originally enrolled participant(s).
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-relationtooriginal: Relationship to original participant (ex., self, child, grandchild, spouse). Describes the familial relationship(s) of participants to the initially enrolled participant(s) in a family-based cohort.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-eligibilitycriteriasummary: A brief summary of the major inclusion and exclusion criteria that determined who could enroll in the study/cohort.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-eligibilitycriteriaurl: Link to the protocol, registry record, or document containing full inclusion/exclusion criteria.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-inclusiontags: High-level inclusion characteristics used to define the enrolled population.
The stable, unique identifier for a stud.x-exclusiontags: High-level exclusion characteristics used to restrict enrollment.
